title: The Art of Garlic Farming: A Look at the Process from Soil to Packaging| Farming Documentary

tasks.task: Prepare the soil for growing garlic.
subtasks: Clear the land of weeds.
Loosen the soil for better aeration.
Ensure proper drainage.
Enrich the soil with organic compost or manure.
Adjust the pH level to six to seven.
Plant garlic cloves manually, ensuring the sprouting end faces upward and maintaining spacing.

tasks.task: Use a garlic planting machine to mechanically enrich the soil and plant cloves.
subtasks: Use a plow to aerate the soil.
Apply fertilizer using specialized equipment.
Deploy a garlic planting machine to dig holes, place cloves, and cover them with soil uniformly.
Loosen the soil around the roots to improve aeration.
Remove weeds to maintain consistency.
Irrigate using drip or sprinkler systems.
Wait until the garlic is fully mature (leaves yellow and drying).
Use a knife or scissors to cut the roots.
Pull the garlic bulbs out of the soil, being careful not to damage them.
Hang the garlic in bundles to dry.
Slice through the soil to sever the garlic bulbs.
Lift the garlic out of the ground using a conveyor or auger.
Separate the garlic from roots and debris.
Sort garlic by size and quality, selecting the best bulbs for fresh sale.
Process damaged garlic into dried products or powders.
Clean the garlic to remove dirt and impurities.
Dry the garlic if necessary.
Package the garlic in appropriate materials for storage and transportation.
